title: How do Persians feel about Greeks since Alexander claimed the Persian Empire? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think Greeks are one of the most influential people of the history if not say the most.this is aside the fact that we don't like Alexander lol. although it is a historical fact that Alexander is not popular among iranians and often referred to as “eskandare gojastag” or the despicable Alexander, it does not excite any feeling of hatred in the mind of a respectable iranian at this age. In addition among the modern iranians almost everything about Greeks and Greek culture is regarded with enthusiasm, curiosity, appreciation and passion towards one of the ancient civilizations that has existed on the face of the earth and the current inheritors of that civilization who might despite the distance share a lot of similarities with us, including common humanistic emotions that can build a future of special friendship and love between the two nations.

Most Iranian do not consider Alexander to be Greek. He is known in Farsi as “Eskandar-e Maghdooni”, or Alexander the Macedonian. Certainly not “the great”, Iranian history is full of stories involving his defeats (as well as eventual triumph) against the Persians, but that is a common theme for Iranians with many other emperors, conquerors and nations. I can not think of a single instance of hearing anything negative about Greeks from an Iranian, other then my close buddy who was prohibited from marrying his long-term Greek girlfriend for not belonging to the Orthodox Church. He dislikes Greeks now, but that's another story.

Many people have “claimed” (e.g., Mongols) the Iranian lands but none have been able to keep it. Iran belongs to the Iranians. In my experience Alexander the Great is respected by most Iranians because he showed respect to the father of the Iranian nation (who was also his inspiration in terms of how to be a ruler). Kourosh-e-Bozorg or Cyrus the Great. Alexander is named after Kourosh. That is, “the Great” is the title that Cyrus made famous. All peoples are respected by most Iranians. However, in my experience some Iranians don’t like Mongols as much.
